phrases: Bilateral knee pain that I've been having for about six months.
Honestly, I don't I can't think of any specific event that caused the pain initially.
It's behind my kneecaps... a deep achy pain.
Anytime if I'm sitting at my desk and I get up I have a lot of pain... going up and down the stairs.
I work from home... my office is downstairs.
I'm a big runner... I run about five to six miles a day... barely can even do half a mile now.
No redness or swelling... no effusion... tender to palpation.
Positive patellar grind test... Lachman, anterior and posterior drawer, and McMurray test are all negative bilaterally.
X-rays of both my knees show no fractures or osteoarthritis.
Symptoms are consistent with patellofemoral pain syndrome.
Continue with over-the-counter NSAIDs... refer her to physical therapy to strengthen lower extremities and correct running mechanics.
Will I be able to run again?
Absolutely... we’re going to get you back.
